	at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.document.StructuredDocumentRegionProxy.getRegions(Unknown Source)

PIF, error pop-up screenshot and workspace .log are available upon request.

Steps to reproduce:
1, Launch Eclipse with a new workspace
2, Import the PIF (to be provided in email upon request)
3, Wait until auto-build completes
4, Get build error pop-up with the following error in workspace .log file:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-08-28 11:52:07.125
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Loading artifact edit for project".
!STACK 0

Expected result:
The same PIF builds error free on Eclipse 3.0.2, so it should build error free on Eclipse 3.2.2
Again, I can see lot of errors webtools related.
Szymon, make sure you change the bug owner when you move a bug to another component.

Thanks for routing this around. 

I don't know what a pif file is (you can't attach it here?) but it appears from the trace that part of our code is trying to change the DOM from inside the notifyChanged method, which is should not do, since that leads to threading problems and things being in an invalid state. This will take some investigation with Chuck and team.
